security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure documentation and workflow definition file (SKILL.md) with no executable code. It contains only metadata, activation keywords, and documentation for security workflows. No network calls, file system access, command execution, or data collection capabilities are present.

content.user_title: Validate security and scan for vulnerabilities
content.value_statement: This skill helps developers identify security vulnerabilities in their codebase and validate security configurations. It provides automated scanning tools and compliance checklists to ensure your projects meet security standards.
actual_capabilities: Run Bandit security scanner on Python source code
Check dependencies for known vulnerabilities with pip-audit and Safety
Validate GPG and SSH key configurations
Execute Semgrep security rules for comprehensive scanning
limitations: Requires pre-installed security tools (Bandit, pip-audit, Safety, Semgrep)
Does not automatically fix vulnerabilities found
Limited to Python project security patterns
Does not provide real-time threat monitoring

best_practices: Run security scans as part of your pre-commit workflow to catch issues early
Combine multiple scanning tools (Bandit, Semgrep, pip-audit) for comprehensive coverage
Address all HIGH and CRITICAL severity findings before releasing code
anti_patterns: Skipping security scans to meet deadline pressures
Ignoring LOW severity findings that may accumulate over time
Running scans only on production code instead of throughout development

faq.question: What security tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill uses Bandit for Python security scanning, pip-audit and Safety for dependency vulnerabilities, and Semgrep for comprehensive rule-based scanning.

faq.question: Can this skill fix vulnerabilities automatically?
faq.answer: No, this skill identifies and reports vulnerabilities. Developers must manually fix issues based on the recommendations provided.

faq.question: Does this skill support languages other than Python?
faq.answer: Semgrep supports multiple languages, but Bandit and pip-audit are Python-specific. Other language support depends on the tools configured.

faq.question: Is my code sent to external servers during scanning?
faq.answer: Local tools run on your machine. Bandit, pip-audit, and Safety query their respective databases for vulnerability definitions only.

faq.question: Why are no workflow files executing?
faq.answer: Ensure required tools are installed (Bandit, pip-audit, Safety, Semgrep) and available in your PATH. Run uv sync first if using the template.

faq.question: How does this compare to GitHub's security features?
faq.answer: This skill provides immediate local scanning during development. GitHub Dependabot and CodeQL offer complementary cloud-based analysis on pull requests.
